page.title: 14THE SHOPKEEPER, THORALBY
page.content: Our local shop-keeper and her husband have owned the shop for 24 years. The shop sells groceries, fruit, vegetables, household goods and newspapers. It is also the local Post Office. Bread, sugar, tea, flour and margarine are the most common items sold. "Radio Times" & "Woman's Own" are the most popular magazines. Customers come from the surrounding farms and villages and they deliver orders to people who ask for one. The shop has a deep freeze for ice-cream and frozen foods. Children buy sweets on their way home from school. The shop-keeper's husband runs a school taxi service for local children. The shop was previously owned by the husband's family. Deliveries come from big towns like Darlington and Bishop Auckland and once a week they go to the Cash and Carry warehouse.
